text: I'm so happy I mean I really think this
is an amazing moment for him of course
but for all Colombians you know we have
been in a roller coaster of emotions we
had the peace agreement with so many
important people coming to Colombia to
Cartagena to to accompany the the the
the peace signing and then we had the
vote against the peace agreement by
Colombians last Sunday and now we have
the this Nobel Peace Prize and it just
you know reinforces the certainty the
conviction that peace has no reverse and
that it's gonna be successful and that
we're gonna live in peace in very soon
yet more than 50% of the population
rejected the peace deal in that
referendum why do you think that was
there were many reasons but there were
side reasons there was a debate that was
linked to the peace agreement and and
those who were voting or promoting the
vote against - no we're trying to say
that by signing with the FARC communist
values materialistic values will then be
imposed onto Colombians that was one one
of the reasons the other reason was
whether we had horrendous weather the
the hurricane Mathieu was passing
through the coast of Colombia and so
those in the regions of the codes that
were going to vote and in majority that
we're going to vote yes were deterred
from going to cast their votes so there
are a couple of reasons but you know the
margin was very small I think that the
polarization for this peace agreement
cannot
cast a shadow on on the conviction that
Colombians have that this is the moment
to end the war
